issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Users that are sync'ed with the internal LDAP client are not able to login, if the user's password contains special characters (example @ ).
fields.summary: UI can't authorize user with @ in a password.

comments.body: Start investigation to put it into sustaining's radar.
[~chuck], please get this issue assigned within the sustaining team for 3.3.1.
LDAP users with passwords that contain the special char @ are able to login to the admin console.  Further investigation is required with the user console.

Just fyi, I could reproduce the issue with "@" in the password w/o LDAP. User could login to admin console but not user console with the password "p@ssword". 
Thanks,
-M
The user console was tested with passwords containing special characters. I'll go test this again to be sure though, specifically with that character.

I've been able to test and do see the failure on my own setup. I added some debug and verified the proxy is getting the proper account/user/password from the browser, and that the basic auth string is being constructed properly for the STS service. I am trying to remember where on the CLC this was handled to check that code.

2013-07-19 14:46:14 INFO trying to auth with atuser, admin, my@password
2013-07-19 14:46:14 INFO auth string = YWRtaW4=@YXR1c2Vy:my@password
(that last string gets base64 encoded as a whole, prepended with "Basic ", and set as the Authorization header.)

eucalyptus/clc/modules/tokens/src/main/java/com/eucalyptus/tokens/ws/TokensQueryPipeline.java

looking now.
[~dkavanagh], I will do a test run with your prosed change. Stay tuned.
It looks like the proposed fix would not work for the case of changing a password when the original password contains @ (I have not tested it)
Actually the fix looks good (as in the case of a password change the original password is B64 encoded)
:) And I've manually tested password change :)

Hey [~dkavanagh]/[~sjones]/[~vasya],

With this fix are we saying that we are supporting changing LDAP passwords via the User Console now?  Additionally, does this mean that the euare-user(add|mod)loginprofile will support this as well?  If it does mean this, should we update our documentation regarding LDAP/AD Integration (I think before, we didn't support this)?

I'm not sure where you got that from. I don't think this bug or fix had anything to do with LDAP. It was strictly a string parsing issue related to the STS service support of basic auth for the user console. Any relation to LDAP is coincidental.

Hey [~dkavanagh],

Correct me if I am wrong, but the issue was initially how the "@" sigh was being used to determine if a password was needing to be reset or not?  I wasn't sure if this patch was changing what triggers a change password functionality that we didn't have before when LDAP/AD integration was enabled.  Does this make sense?
We do not support password change via User Console if LDAP integration is ON.

Verified fix with {{p@ssword}}, {{foob@r}}.
